channel.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
channel.description: Alright, so for the past few hours my phone has struggled to keep any 1X/3G/4G connection at all. I've restarted it multiple times, cleared the cache, etc. However it still sits at 1X and sometimes gets 3G, but often drops signal entirely forcing me to restart. It started doing this right after I drove home through a storm, in which lightning struck close enough to set off car alarms in cars in parking spaces right next to me. Could this be a cause, or is it more likely that my carrier is having issues? Other phones in the house have signal, at least it says they do but I haven't tested to see if it actually sends messages.

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

asshole_rule:

were you using the phone?

This was old but no, it was sitting next to me in my cup holder while driving.

Read full topic
item.source: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

CoonHunter:

Future tip: When my phone starts having issues like this I generally do a full reinstall/restore of the stock OS and setup like new. Can be a hassle though depending on how much you have on your phone

Pretty much the answer I expected from you lol.

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

The strange thing is that other family members have the same phone (LG G3) and didn’t have the issues I was having. It continued to drop signal throughout the night but has since restored normal operations.

Read full topic

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I doubt it fucked with your single cellphone…
But like justin said…
It could have interfered with the towers and all that good shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

more likely that the storm has affected local comms infrastructure

item.source: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Eyeownyew, post:2, topic:552617”]Lightning*…?

It’s much more likely that it’s unrelated. The noise/vibrations are what set off the car alarms, not the EM disturbance. I doubt it could have an effect on your phone.[/quote]
Updated my spelling, I’ve never been that great with spelling or grammar in general.

Anyways, the example with the car alarms was to kinda show how close it was. I’ll take your word for it and see if it straightens itself out. Messages seem to be sending a bit more like normal as the storm leaves the county. Still nowhere near as fast.

Read full topic
item.source: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?

item.title: Could Lightning Have Damaged My Phone?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Lightning*…?

It’s much more likely that it’s unrelated. The noise/vibrations are what set off the car alarms, not the EM disturbance. I doubt it could have an effect on your phone.

Read full topic
